page.title: 15Whiteways Cider Factory
page.content: Whiteways Cider Factory is at{Hele (grid ref.996022). It was first built in the 18th century. It was first used as a farmhouse. Whiteways has been making{cider}since 1934. Whiteways is the largest drinks factory in Europe. This Hele factory is a small part of Whiteways. The factory used to have 15 men working there but now there are only 8 men working. On the 29th May it closed down. They closed down because it was too small so the men were made redundant. They used to collect apples from their orchards and ship them to Shepton Mallet, and ferment the juice to take to Whimple to make cider. They also bottled cider in 5 gallon containers. They would bottle 800 containers a day. Several{Bradninch people work for Whiteways.
